metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10087 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The kernel_wait4 function in kernel/exit.c in the Linux kernel before 4.13, when an unspecified architecture and compiler is used, might allow local users to cause a denial of service by triggering an attempted use of the -INT_MIN value. It was discovered that the wait4() system call in the Linux kernel did not properly validate its arguments in some situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10087` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
